item.item: The reference of the taxonomic standard in which the current taxon is published.
This attribute holds the internet address in which the current taxon is published.
The level or relative position in the taxonomic hierarchy.
This attribute holds the enumerated value describing the rank or position in the taxonomic hierarchy.
This type defines the enumerated set of all taxonomic ranks.
The highest taxonomic rank or relative position in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The second highest taxonomic rank below domain in the taxonomic hierarchy.
A subclass of the kingdom rank in the taxonomic hierarchy.
A subclass of the kingdom rank in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above phylum or division and below kingdom in the taxonomic hierarchy. In botany, the term superdivision is used in place of superphylum.
The taxonomic rank below kingdom and above class in the taxonomic hierarchy. In botany, the term division is used in place of phylum.
The taxonomic rank below phylum or division and above infraphylum in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below subphylum and above microphylum in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below infraphylum in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above class in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below superclass and above subclass in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below class and above infraclass in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below subclass and above parvclass in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below infraclass in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below class and above cohort in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below legion in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above superorder in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above grandorder and below magnorder in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above mirorder and below superorder in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above order and below grandorder in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above suborder and below mirorder in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above infraorder and below order in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above parvorder and below suborder in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank and below infraorder in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above family in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below superfamily and above subfamily in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The author of the family epithet in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below family in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above tribe in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below supertribe and above subtribe in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below tribe/em> in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above subgenus in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The author of the genus epithet in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below genus and above section in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below subgenus and above series in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below section in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank above species in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below superspecies and above subspecies in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The author of the species epithet in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below species and above infraspecies in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The author of the subspecies epithet in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below subspecies and above form in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The author of the variety epithet in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The taxonomic rank below variety in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The author of the form epithet in the taxonomic hierarchy.

The full scientific name comprising epithets and rank abbreviations, excluding authorship. Unless of higher rank, the name should start at the genus rank and provide the most specific infraspecies rank.
The scientific name authority at the lowest taxonomic rank.
The valid or preferred scientific name related to the current taxon.
The taxonomic epithet comprising all elements below the rank of species in the taxonomic hierarchy.
The author of the lowest rank epithet in the taxonomic hierarchy.
